Articles.Content:
A Series of mission reports, following my attempts the complete various challenges.

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_

Challenge:

 - Apollo application program, a series, of mission following the original moon missions, leading onto fictional missions, using developed Apollo hardware.

![Tf94C0n.png](http://i.imgur.com/Tf94C0n.png)

 The badge of 

completion, for the 

 challenge

- - - Updated - - -

Part one: Building missiles

First, the challenge requires at least two rockets, the Saturn IB, and Saturn V. There are other optional one's, but for now, I'll hold off on them until they are needed. The rockets are built and tested, know its time to move on to testing the command module, and Landing module. This will be more interesting, but you've got to start somewhere.

 (here's a link to the album, until I figure out how to actually imbed them)

 [http://imgur.com/a/70rWY#0](http://imgur.com/a/70rWY#0)
